summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of EduPlan application. Fixed critical authentication issue and successfully tested all required pages and functionality. Login works perfectly, dashboard shows all 6 sections, and all management pages (students, teachers, rooms, seating plans, sandbox, classes) are functional with correct data counts.

design_issues.issue: React 19 ref warnings and missing Columns3 import warning
design_issues.details: Multiple React 19 ref access warnings and one import warning for Columns3 from lucide-react
design_issues.impact: No functional impact, just console noise

design_issues.details: User session seems to expire after a few minutes of inactivity

passed_tests: Login page loads correctly and accepts provided credentials (stm001/vie-scolaire/vs.stmarie/VieScol2024!)
Role dropdown selection works with specific selector method
Authentication successful and redirects to dashboard
Dashboard displays all 6 required sections: Classes, Élèves, Professeurs, Salles, Plans de classe, Bac à sable
Students page (/dashboard/students) shows exactly 18 students with filtering and management features
Teachers page (/dashboard/teachers) shows exactly 6 teachers with detailed information and class assignments
Rooms page (/dashboard/rooms) shows exactly 4 rooms with management and configuration options
Seating Plans page (/dashboard/seating-plan) shows 10 sub-rooms with seating plan management
Sandbox page (/dashboard/sandbox) shows proposal system with different statuses (validated, refused, pending)
Classes page (/dashboard/classes) shows 4 classes (3A, 6A, 6B, 6ème U) with proper management interface
All navigation between pages works correctly
User interface is clean, responsive and properly styled
All data counts match exactly the requirements specified

success_percentage.frontend: 95% - All core functionality working, minor console warnings and session management issues
success_percentage.backend: Not tested - frontend only testing as requested

action_item_for_main_agent: OPTIONAL: Consider fixing React 19 ref warnings and extending session timeout for better user experience. The Columns3 import issue was already noted as fixed in the review request.
